title: 115_hr2382
content: The Act titled "Permanent Flexibility for School Meals Act" establishes nutritional requirements for school lunch and breakfast programs. Amendments to the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act include changes to nutritional requirements and program guidelines. Amendments to the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act involve updating nutritional requirements to nutrition guidelines for compliance. Amendments to the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act involve updating nutritional requirements to nutrition guidelines for compliance, including changes to terminology and permissions for serving meals. Amendments to the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act involve updating nutritional requirements to nutrition guidelines for compliance, including changes to terminology and permissions for serving meals consisting of a combination of foods meeting nutrition guidelines issued by the Secretary. Amendments to the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act involve updating nutritional requirements to nutrition guidelines, including changes to terminology and permissions for serving meals meeting nutrition guidelines issued by the Secretary. Amendments to the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act involve updating nutritional requirements to nutrition guidelines, including changes to terminology and permissions for serving meals meeting guidelines issued by the Secretary. The guidelines shall not prohibit institutions, family or group day care homes, and sponsored centers. The amendments to the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act involve updating nutritional requirements to nutrition guidelines, allowing institutions to serve meals meeting the guidelines without restrictions on accommodating special dietary needs. Amendments to the Child Nutrition Act involve changing nutritional requirements to nutrition guidelines, giving institutions flexibility in meeting the guidelines without restrictions on special dietary needs. Amendments to the Child Nutrition Act involve changing nutritional requirements to nutrition guidelines, allowing institutions flexibility in meeting the guidelines without restrictions on special dietary needs. The minimum nutritional requirements will be measured by the weekly average of the nutrient content of school breakfasts. In paragraph (1)(B), "nutritional requirements prescribed" will be replaced with "nutrition guidelines issued."
